alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 4:45AM AKST until January 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below and blowing snow expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting to 25 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...In Brooks Range Passes. * WHEN...Until noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting to 25 mph will cause of blowing and drifting snow in passes. Cold wind chills to 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
